H2O.title: Water (H2O)
H2O.summary: Water is a polar molecule that dissolves many ionic and polar substances.
properties: Liquid at room temperature with high heat capacity.
Bent geometry and polarity enable hydrogen bonding.
Expands on freezing, which lowers the density of ice.
applications: Universal solvent in biology and chemistry.
Used in cooling, cleaning, and as a reaction medium.

NaCl.title: Sodium chloride (NaCl)
NaCl.summary: Sodium chloride is an ionic solid made of Na+ and Cl- ions arranged in a crystal lattice.
properties: High melting point due to strong ionic bonding.
Soluble in water, producing an electrolyte solution.
applications: De-icing roads and industrial brine production.

CO2.title: Carbon dioxide (CO2)
CO2.summary: Carbon dioxide is a linear, nonpolar molecule that is a common product of combustion and respiration.
properties: Gas at room temperature with low reactivity.
Sublimes at -78.5 deg C to dry ice.
Acts as a greenhouse gas by absorbing infrared radiation.
applications: Used in carbonation of beverages and fire extinguishers.
Dry ice provides cooling without liquid residue.

NH3.title: Ammonia (NH3)
NH3.summary: Ammonia is a polar molecule with a lone pair on nitrogen and a pungent odor.
properties: Basic in water, forming ammonium and hydroxide ions.
Strong hydrogen bonding leads to a higher boiling point than similar mass gases.
applications: Key feedstock for fertilizers and nitric acid production.
Used in refrigeration systems and household cleaners.
NH3.safety: Ammonia gas is toxic and irritating; avoid inhalation and use ventilation.

CH4.title: Methane (CH4)
CH4.summary: Methane is a tetrahedral, nonpolar molecule and the main component of natural gas.
properties: Low boiling point and high flammability.
applications: Fuel for heating and electricity generation.
Feedstock for hydrogen and methanol production.
CH4.safety: Methane is flammable; use proper leak detection in enclosed spaces.

Fe2O3.title: Iron(III) oxide (Fe2O3)
Fe2O3.summary: Iron(III) oxide is a common iron oxide found in rust and hematite.
properties: Reddish-brown solid with mixed ionic and covalent bonding.
Insoluble in water and stable at room temperature.
applications: Used as a pigment and in polishing compounds.
Hematite is an important iron ore.
